definition: oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning

sentences.english: A quick mind, have slippery mouth skin.
sentences.chinese: 有靈活的頭腦，有油滑嘴皮。

sentences.english: When salt and pepper shakers are greasy to touch or half empty .
sentences.chinese: 鹽及胡椒瓶是油滑的，或是半空的。

sentences.english: When used correctly, it slightly gives an "oily" feeling to the skin.
sentences.chinese: 如果正確使用，會有皮膚那種輕微的油滑感。

sentences.english: Beware of that peddler, for he is slippery as an eel .
sentences.chinese: 當心那個小販，他油滑得很。

sentences.english: The LORD shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things
sentences.chinese: 凡油滑的嘴脣，和誇大的舌頭，耶和華必要剪除。

sentences.english: I never feel that that fellow is really sincere; he's too mealy- mouthed.
sentences.chinese: 我從來沒感到那個傢伙是真心實意的，他太油滑了。

sentences.english: 3May the Lord cut off all flattering lips and every boastful tongue
sentences.chinese: 凡油滑的嘴脣，和誇大的舌頭，耶和華必要剪除。

definition: flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
experienced in the ways of the world (idiom); worldly-wise/sophisticated
